```{r}
# create matrix with 4 columns and 4 rows
data= matrix(0, nrow = 5, ncol=6)
 
# specify the column names and row names of matrix
colnames(data) = c('Underweight','Normal weight','Overweight','Obesity class I', 'Obesity class II', 'Obesity class III')
rownames(data) <- c('Normal','Elevated','High Stage 1','High Stage 2', 'Hypertensive crisis')
 
# assign to table
final=as.table(data)
 
# display
final
```
